basic.description: An introduction to graph theory, and a survey of graph theoretic algorithms as applied to classic and contemporary problems in combinatorics and computer science. Topics include: colouring, isomorphism, connectivity, network flow, matchings, planarity, shortest path problems, NP- completeness. Three term-hours; lectures and seminars. Robin Dawes.
basic.subject: CISC
basic.title: Fuzzy Logic and Fuzzy Algorithms
